title: My Back End Developer Journey
info: Back-end developers are very important for the functionality of a website but they are not as visible as front-end developers. Here is my journey to becoming a back-end developer...
body:
Everyone says look, how beautiful this website looks but nobody says look, how fast these data are being retrived from database and being displayed here.

Back-end as name suggest are like brain of the programs. You cannot see them from outside but they are important to do any function in programs.

They are responsible for everything that is done in background while user clicks something. Unlike front end developer whose work is shown to every users since they are responsible to display data to users and make sure it looks visually pleasing, backend have different responsible.
Their work is done in background and it is mostly being processed in servers where normal users cannot interact directly. The bridge between these are mostly connected by something called 'API' which backend developers are responsible for.
The front end developers can utilize these API to access all the functions that back end developer created to make program runs and interact with servers.
Back end devs are also tasked with managing these data and retrieving/storing data in database. They then make sure any unauthorized users don't get access to these data with authentication and give limited access to allowed users with authorization.
They are also responsible for testing of the program to make sure there are not any bugs and fix it so that users don't get any issues on their part and deploy it.

The reason why I want to become a back end programmer instead of front end is because desiging is not for me. Since I was a kid, I have always liked using electronic device and wondered how they are functioning. I used to see my dad fix the TV, watch and such and seeing those inside parts which normal users don't see joined together and function was facinating. That was probably one of my motivation to be in technology industry.
I like to do tasks where I can think of a problem, find a solution, utilize it and see the result. This gives me satisfaction because I can see myself fixing the problem.
So, even if we may not get as many credits by users, I still like being one and will always work towards my goal.
Thank you for reading!

title: My Sleep Paralysis
info: I've had sleep paralysis for as long as I can remember. It's a terrifying experience that I wouldn't wish on anyone...
body:
Sleep Paralysis is a moment between dream and reality.
It is a specific time frame where you wake up but your body is still in dream so your brain gets confused. Since you are still in dream but you are also awake, your dream and reality starts to overlap. This is when your dream starts to become reality.
You start to see things that are not there. You start to feel things that are not there. You start to hear things that are not there.
Then you try to move your body but since you are still asleep, your body in real life can't move (hence, sleep paralysis).

This is not lethal which will cause permanent harm to anyone but it is still a scary feeling. This can affect your sleep pattern or even make you afraid of sleeping.
I have not found any permanent solutions for it yet but I might know what causes it for me. I will list it here in case someone else has it. This might or might not help but you can give it a try.

Normally, when this happens, I noticed that I am going to my sleep late or too much tired. I have also seen this happen when I am stressed out.
So, If you have it, I recommend avoiding stressing yourself too much. If something is bothering you, try to solve it before going to sleep.
Also, try to sleep early and have a good sleep. This might help you to avoid sleep paralysis.
But if you still have it, I recommend you to see a doctor. They might have a better solution for you.
Good luck!

title: AI and Me
info: Artificial Intelligence is a fascinating field that I've been exploring lately. It's amazing to see how machines can learn and adapt to new situations...
body:
AI IS GOING TO TAKE MY JOB. THESE SHOULD BE STOPPED.

If you have been on the internet, you might have seen these concerns floating around. Artificial Intelligence, also known as AI, refers to a type of intelligence created using various algorithms that replicate human intelligence.

These AIs are sets of algorithms that train themselves using existing data and improve over time. They can use their own outputs to further refine and enhance their performance. This is one reason why early AI systems were often poor, but they have become highly effective now, capable of fooling most people who are not technologically savvy.

Still don't understand? Think of it like this: AI, when starting out, is like a baby. You feed it information to train it, similar to how you teach a baby new thing. You show a baby a picture of the letter “A” and their brain stores that information as the letter “A.” When you show that picture again in the future, they recognize it. This is also how AI models function, but there is something AI lacks that humans possess: human emotions.
When a mother raises a child, the child naturally develops trust and feelings towards the mother. If you tell the child to hate the mother for no reason, the child will likely refuse. However, an AI will 'hate' if it is programmed to do so, unless it has been explicitly trained not to.

Just like humans, AI is affected by how it is trained. If you train your AI with poor-quality information, it will produce poor-quality outputs during testing. For example, in 2016, Microsoft released a Twitter bot called Tay. Immediately after its release, they had to shut it down because it started posting offensive tweets. This happened because Tay was training itself using Twitter interactions, and people began trolling it with offensive replies.

There are also many controversies about AI at the time of this writing. Artists dislike it because people train their AI using the artists' work for free, replicating their art. This results in artists losing customers since people can use AI to create similar art at a lower cost and faster pace. Additionally, many people fear that AI will replace their jobs in the future and are calling for the government to implement laws to halt AI development.

However, I don't think the development of AI should stop. Given the rapid pace of development, it might be scary to think about, but stopping AI also means halting technological progress. AI should be used as a tool to improve jobs, not replace them. It should help people complete tasks faster. For instance, a game developer can create some house models for their game and use AI to enhance them, speeding up development. This can help them complete projects more quickly, allowing for more future work opportunities.
